title: Dark minimal split-layout portfolio with rotating vinyl, audio toggle, and glass overlays

requirements.summary: Implement a single-page dark minimal UI with a full-viewport dimmed bg.png background and white typography.
acceptanceCriteria: The background covers the full viewport without tiling or stretching artifacts (uses a cover-style treatment).
A dimming treatment is applied so foreground white text is readable.
All primary text renders in white or near-white and maintains sufficient contrast against the dimmed background.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page layout root that renders a full-viewport background using the static asset bg.png with a dimming overlay layer and white/near-white typography applied to primary text.
Add global styling entry point for dark minimal appearance (e.g., base background/foreground variables and default text color) to ensure white typography reads over the dimmed background.

requirements.summary: Build a responsive, horizontally split Flexbox layout with left content column and right vinyl column that adapts on small screens.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop widths, content is displayed as two side-by-side columns (left and right) using Flexbox.
On narrow/mobile widths, the layout adapts to avoid overlap (e.g., columns stack and remain usable).
No interactive element is clipped off-screen at common viewport sizes (mobile and desktop).

file_operations.description: Implement the split layout using Flexbox (left column for title/tagline/categories, right column for vinyl UI) with responsive breakpoints to stack/reflow on small screens and prevent overlap/clipping.

requirements.summary: Render the left column title, cursive italic tagline, and an interactive vertical category list with the required labels.
acceptanceCriteria: The title text matches exactly: "shibhi.studio".
The tagline text matches exactly and is styled cursive and italic.
The categories appear as a vertical list with clear spacing and are clickable/tappable.

file_operations.description: Create a frontend-accessible structured data source defining the category labels (Photography, Blender & Animations, Design, Electronics) and associated content payloads for dynamic overlay loading.
Render the left column with exact title text "shibhi.studio", the exact cursive italic tagline, and a vertical list of category controls sourced from frontend/src/content/categories.ts.

requirements.summary: Add hover/active/pointer/focus affordances and keyboard accessibility for categories, overlays, and play/pause.
acceptanceCriteria: Category items show a pointer cursor and visible hover styling on desktop.
Category items and the play/pause button have visible focus styles when navigated via keyboard.
Users can toggle play/pause using keyboard activation on the play/pause control.
Users can open a category overlay via keyboard activation on a category item.

file_operations.description: Create an accessible overlay component for category content. Use the shadcn-ui Dialog component to provide keyboard accessibility (focus management, Escape-to-close) and interaction patterns; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure category items and play/pause are implemented as keyboard-activatable controls with visible focus styles (focus-visible), hover/active states, and correct open/close/toggle behaviors wired to the overlay and audio state.
Add/adjust global focus-visible styling (or Tailwind base overrides) so keyboard focus indicators are clearly visible on dark backgrounds.

requirements.summary: Show a large vinyl.png in the right column and rotate it smoothly only while audio is playing.
acceptanceCriteria: The vinyl image is visibly large relative to the right column and remains fully visible without overlap.
When playback is active, the vinyl rotates smoothly (no stuttery frame-to-frame jumps).
When playback is paused, the vinyl stops rotating (or holds its current angle) and remains still.

file_operations.description: Create a VinylPlayer component that renders vinyl.png at a large size and applies a smooth CSS-based continuous rotation animation when in the playing state, pausing the animation when not playing.
Wire the right column to render the VinylPlayer component and pass it the playing/paused state so rotation starts and stops appropriately.

requirements.summary: Add a centered play/pause toggle atop the vinyl that controls MP3 playback and the vinyl rotation state.
acceptanceCriteria: The play/pause control is visually centered on top of the vinyl image.
Clicking/tapping the control starts audio playback and starts rotation.
Clicking/tapping again pauses audio playback and pauses rotation.
The controlâ€™s label/icon clearly reflects the current state (play vs pause).

file_operations.description: Add a centered play/pause button layered above the vinyl that toggles an HTMLAudioElement playing state and keeps the rotation state in sync. Use the shadcn-ui Button component for consistent styling and accessibility; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement glassmorphism category overlays that open per category and show dynamically selected content, with dismiss controls.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking a category opens an overlay panel above the main layout.
The overlay uses a glassmorphism look (semi-transparent background and visible backdrop blur).
Overlay content is loaded dynamically based on which category was clicked (not hardcoded to a single static block).
The overlay can be dismissed (e.g., close button and/or clicking outside and/or Escape key).

file_operations.description: Implement the glassmorphism styling (semi-transparent surface plus backdrop blur) and render dynamic content based on the selected category data; ensure dismiss via close control, click-outside, and Escape (via Dialog behavior).
Manage selected-category state and wire category clicks/keyboard activation to open CategoryOverlay with the correct dynamically loaded content.

requirements.summary: Reference bg.png, vinyl.png, and the MP3 as frontend static assets in a way that works under non-root base paths.
acceptanceCriteria: The page loads bg.png and vinyl.png correctly in production builds without relying on absolute root-only paths.
The MP3 file is fetched and played successfully in production builds.
No broken asset links occur when the app is hosted under a subpath (not just domain root).

file_operations.description: Add the static background image asset bg.png to the frontend public directory so it is served as a static file.
Add the static vinyl image asset vinyl.png to the frontend public directory so it is served as a static file.
Add an MP3 audio file (audio.mp3) as a frontend static asset to be played by the vinyl play/pause control.
Create a small helper that builds static asset URLs using the app base path (e.g., import.meta.env.BASE_URL) so asset references remain valid under subpath hosting.
Update bg.png usage to resolve via the base-path-safe asset URL helper (not hardcoded absolute paths) and ensure the background is applied with cover-style behavior.
Update vinyl.png and audio.mp3 references to resolve via the base-path-safe asset URL helper so playback and images work when hosted under a subpath.
Ensure the HTML entry remains compatible with subpath builds (avoid introducing absolute root-only asset paths in the document).
